alert.note: Alert for Estill; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Powell, southern Montgomery, Estill and southwestern Menifee Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harris Ferry, or 12 miles northwest of Irvine, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Harris Ferry and Westbend around 630 PM EDT. Palmer, Iron Mound, Cressy and Virden around 635 PM EDT. Clay City, Spout Springs, Powell Valley and Waltersville around 640 PM EDT. Hargett, Fox and Kimbrell around 645 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
